fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7572].
  {panel}

It would be amazing to have the ability to define a section of a Wiki page to be in "Outline Mode". Such a definition would enable a page to contain expandable and collapsable blocks of lists. Nesting of lists should be supported. Also having the ability to edit the page in WYSIWYG Outline Mode would greatly enhance the usability of the app.

Macro Features:
- Property: startClosed - (bool, Optional, def: false) - If true, all lists under the current list node would start of as closed
- Allow for nesting. Outline macros can be defined within Outline macros.
- Should be able to wrap headings as well as lists.
- Both Headings and lists items should be expandable.
- (Phase2+) Allow for WYSIWYG Outline Editing :-)

Notes:
- This feature should follow the "One Pane" view such as that in Omni Outliner (OSX), and Ecco Pro (Win).  See http://john.redmood.com/organizers.html for information on Outline types.
- The main difficulty of WYSIWYG Outlining with a web browser is capturing of Tab and Shift-Tab for indent control from keyboard which is very important feature. Not sure if this is possible with web browsers... Maybe switch to alt-tab, alt-shift-ta b(or) alt-tilde (~).
fields.summary: Outline Mode Macro - Create ability to define a block viewed in Outline Mode

fields.description:
There is no easy way to list all edits in chronological order for either me, or another user.  Mei Yan Chan [meiyan.chan@atlassian.com] notes in email response to my mailing list question:

You can actually list the most recent edits of pages through the 'History' which is located top right of the Dashboard. However, the popup will also list the most recent pages that you have viewed. Hence, you may have a problem distinguishing the pages you have edited/contributed from the viewed pages.

Note that this feature is provided by MediaWiki when you go to a user's page and click on "User Contributions" ; see e.g. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Contributions/JordanSamuels .
fields.summary: Easy way to list all edits by a particular user

fields.description:
Please see the attached PDF file.
When I add this PDF to a Confluence page as the attachment and then I try to Search the word (for example, "zdaru"), the word is found.
If however I search for a word containing *certain* international (Czech) characters, Confluence does not find it.
Good such words are "účelem & "dříve" - I am attaching these two words as the picture and as a MS Word document (just in case...).
The reason why such words cannot be found are also shown on the picture.  When indexing, the PDF decrypter apparently inserts a space after problematic Czech letters and hence such words cannot be found later.
fields.summary: Conluence Search doesn't find words containing international characters in PDF attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7568].
  {panel}

At present, the database setup guides do not adequately describe how to migrate Confluence from the embedded database to an external one as they are intended for users setting up a new database from scratch. However, the Migrating+to+a+Different+Database guide does not cover any database setup or database-specific steps.

Each guide should cover both new db setup and migration, possibly in separate docs, with the generic migration document removed once this is complete. This will reduce support load from uses who do not correctly configure their database permissions in particular.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+Guides
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+to+a+Different+Database
fields.summary: Expand Database Setup guides to cover transferring content and new database setup

fields.description:
I was editing a page on http://extranet.atlassian.com/x/C4LHHQ 
and wanted to create a simple bulleted list :

    *  easy        -> respond immediately
    *  medium -> research required, put in Triage
    *  urgent     -> notify dev guys

I manually entered the empty spaces between each '->' to make sure that the subtitles are in an ordered column, under each other.

However, wiki markup completely ignores the white spaces entered between words. Hence you can't manually tab to a specific location on a page, kind of annoying.

The RT editor is smarter and inserts '  for each blank space.

* easy        \-> respond immediately
* medium \-> research required, put in Triage
* urgent   \-> notify dev guys |

Thus producing the accurate result.
fields.summary: White spaces ignored in WIKI markup

fields.description:
Use of pipe character '|' for both link alias and macro parameter syntax prevents links aliases for links the title of a note, tip, warnings or info macro.

To replicate:
1. Create space with key TEST and homepage Home

2. Edit homepage in wiki markup mode and insert 
{note:title=[Link Alias|TEST:Home]}
Note Body Text
{note}

3. Save page to view link title rendered in plain text as [Link Alias instead of a link with the title Link Alias

Possible workaround:

Create a pre-parser for the 4 panel macros that that iterates over the macro parameter text before it is parsed into parameters and escapes pipe characters meeting the link '[' <Alias> '|' <optional Space> ':' Title ']' syntax . These must later be unescaped when rendering. This should not interfere with unrelated macros, (eg. {some-macro:var1=alpha[value|var2=beta]value} should still set var1=alpha[value and var2=beta]value)
fields.summary: Enable alias for links in the title of a note, tip, warnings or info macro

fields.description:
In c.a.c., which is now running 2.3, I cannot indent bullets properly using the Rich Text WYSIWYG editor. In order to create 2nd level bullets, I have to go into wiki markup and add the 2nd asterisk.

I'm attaching two screenshots to illustrate the issue. In the first screenshot, wysiwygeditortest1.jpg, you can see that I've created a top level bullet and two indented bullets. Then I clicked Save. The result is shown in wysiwygeditortest2.jpg. Note: to create the indented bullets, I first used the tab key on my keyboard, then clicked save. Then, I re-edited the page and used the indent icon in the WYSIWYG tool bar. Neither method works. In order to make the indent work, I need to go into wiki markup and type two asterisks.
fields.summary: Indented bullets only work in wiki markup, not WYSIWYG

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7548].
  {panel}

The primary usage case for this is file downloading in actions - its just not possible.

If I want to write a simple plugin which lists the confluence backups and allows them to be downloaded, I have to write a servlet to serve up that file. This is rather awkward as the general way of working in confluence is through actions, and having to drop down to the servlet API makes the plugin more complex than it needs to be.

While the servlet work around functions fine, I would prefer to have the simpler option of just implementing a InputStreamFeed (or better named) interface which has a "InputStream getInputStream() throws IOException" contract. The InputStreamResult picks up on that (like the RssFeed - see CONF-7547) and then writes the data straight out.

The content type and disposition can be set by the action. This could also be achieved by a NullResult which does nothing and having the action grab the response and write to it directly, although thats not really the xwork way of doing things - the outputting should be done by the results.
fields.summary: Add a xwork InputStreamResult class which takes an InputStream and streams it out to the browser
Make the RssResult use an Interface instead of looking up on the Stack

fields.description:
A working example of the problem can be found here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/diffpages.action?originalId=1016036&pageId=163783

This shows the differences between these two versions:

* v27 - http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1016036
* v28 - http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=163783

The most obvious is the first column that has been emptied out in the red and green sections, which are clearly there in the page output when viewing the two versions directly. The differences in the first column is that v27 contains a few links on the version number to the release notes, and v28 contains all the available ones linked.

Version 28 was the latest at the time of filing. C.A.C was also running on Version: 2.3 Build:#640 Dec 29, 2006.

The reason I perceive this to be a critical flaw is that I (and probably many others) use this diff view to find out what has changed in large pages, rather than having to try and work it out myself by reading it all again. I need to be able to trust in the accuracy of the change log - that said, this is the first time in a long time that I've noticed any problems with (also the first time I've checked, though).
fields.summary: Page Comparison information shown is wrong / missing

fields.description:
Here are GUI-problem that concern admins. It has something to do with the tabs. (i am using space-admin and conf-admin exclusiv)

1. A user restrictes the page write access to "me" (that user). All confluence-admins and space-admins should edit the page nethertheless. But logged in as an admin no edit-tab could be seen any more. However you can direct link to the edit page by using the url. The edit-tab should be shown!

2. Second case a user restrictes the page read access to "me". This does also restrictes the write-access with the problem above. A conf-admin could still see this page, thats correct. But a space-admin get the no-access-permission-msg. Although a space-admin can directly access editpage with the url.

3. In continue to 2. look at "edit page" as an admin when read-restriction is set to another user. At the part "page restrictions" and there "read". There is no radio-button marked. Looking at write restriction (when it is set to another user). There the user with the right appears marked with a radio-button. There should be the same behaviour with the read-restriction.

Greetings
Fabian
fields.summary: GUI-problems when accessing restricted pages to antoher user with admin

fields.description:
The horizontal margin to the left and right of the centered panels for note, warning, tip and info macros is quite large and cannot be modified. In many situations, this macro is used with unformatted, left-aligned text above and below it, and the large left-hand margin means that the highlighted text has been indented too far to the right for it to be skimmed in normal reading flow.

It would be useful to:

1) Halve the default margin to make usage within left-aligned text easier to skim-read
2) Introduce a margin parameter to set the horizontal margin whitespace as a percentage of the screen, eg margin=5%

For example, instead of

---------START----------
Links
 * Some link
 * Another link
 
               Im a set out here on the right

More links
 * Linkiness
 * Link link

---------END----------

It would be more readable to be able to have smaller margins and display

---------START----------
Links
 * Some link
 * Another link

  I've been adjusted manually

More links
 * Linkiness
 * Link link
---------END----------
fields.summary: Add horizontal margin parameter for note, warning, tip and info panels and reduce default value

fields.description:
When rendering a link to a page in another space, the space key is not stripped from the page title. Since spacekeys are intended primarily for internal use, they can be safely stripped in this instance. 

[DOC:Home] is currently rendered as DOC:Home but should be rendered as Home instead.

To replicate:

1) Install the Demo space
2) Create a new space
3) Edit the new space homepage and add a link [DS:Home]

If the space key is to be kept, it would be preferable to use the space name instead of the space key, eg have the link [DOC:Home] become Home (Documentation space).
fields.summary: Unaliased link to page in another space should show full space name instead of space key

fields.description:
Macros should be rendered as editable forms in the Rich Text Editor tab.

For example, instead of displaying the markup for a macro, a clickable object with the name of that macro should be embedded. Clicking on the object will load a popup window with 

- Cancel button
- Update button (greyed unless changes have been made)
- A list of parameter description and value pairs that are accepted by that macro. The parameter entry method should match the value type, eg boolean as checkbox, dropdown for preset choices, text for others. 

When naming the macros, the _ and - characters should be converted into spaces and the word Macro appended to the end. 

For example, instead of displaying {recently-updated:spaces=doc,conf20|types=page,comment|width=98%} this should shows a clickable object labelled Recently Updated Macro. Clicking on the object opens a popup window with editable, populated values for Spaces, Types and Width.
fields.summary: Embed macro parameters form in Rich Text Editor instead of markup syntax

fields.description: The Rich Text Editor should enable the insertion of macros using a Macro drop-down that lists all available macros. Once a macro is selected, a popup should appear with Insert and Cancel buttons, and a list of parameter description and value pairs retrieved from the macro. The parameter entry method should match the value type, eg boolean as checkbox, dropdown for preset choices, text for others. Context-specific macros such as column and section can be excluded.
fields.summary: Add drop-down for macro insertion/editing to Rich Text Editor

fields.description:
When a page has been formatted into columns, these are not rendered in the Rich Text Editor. The RTE should render columns and also allow column editing. 

1) RTE UI needs a Columns button that launches a popup window. The popup has parameters for 
- Column border (default: none)
- Column width in either pixels or percentages (default: unset)
- Add Column button
- Close button 
- Space to render up to 8 selectable bars/images corresponding to columns. If the cursor is outside a section, no bars are displayed and the text 'No columns' is shown. If the popup was called while the cursor was inside a section, or a new column was just added, display a selectable bar for each column in that section. If the user selects one of the column bars, that column's border and width are displayed plus new buttons to Update or Delete that column.

2) Render Columns in the RTE as rendered in the Preview tab.
fields.summary: Render columns and sections in Rich Text Editor instead of as wiki markup

fields.description:

c:\confluence\confluence-2.2.10-std           <-- Install directory, unzipped now
c:\confluence\data                            <-- Home directory, created next
{code}

fields.description:
The "Set Up a Cluster Node" page is a mite confusing.

Change wording: "Your Confluence host has multiple network interfaces suitable for clustered communication. Please select one to use." to "Choose the network interface Confluence will use to communicate with the other nodes in the cluster."

Replace two headings "Join a Cluster" and "Create a New Cluster" with "Configure Cluster", with a place to enter the cluster name (laid out like it is currently under Create a New Cluster), then two buttons: "Join existing cluster" and "Create new cluster"

If "Create new cluster" is selected, then take the user to a new screen to select the type of database (use the regular database setup action, but disable the option to choose an embedded database)
fields.summary: Cluster setup workflow could be improved

fields.description:
In your Installing Confluece Standalone instructions (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Confluence+Standalone) you instruct one to...

Stage three: Download and Unzip Confluence
1. ...
2.  If you have not downloaded Confluence already, download the Standalone zip

There is a link to a download table.  Based on your various instructions, one would assume that there is no difference between the zip version of the download and the tarball, but such is not the case.  The zip verison seems to be specifically targetted to a PC.  In all other cases, one must use the tarball.  Since zip arechives are also commonplace on Macintosh systems, you might want to be more clear that the zip is for Windows OS only.
fields.summary: Confluence installations instructions a bit misleading for a Macintosh user

fields.description:
When creating a page, and having latin characters such as &, " ", etc, a URL is generated like this: http://www.gigaspaces.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=8375 and not http://www.gigaspaces.com/wiki/display/GS/Welcome+to+GigaSpaces.

This is improtant because we tend to use & a lot in page titles since some of our page titles are very long and this helps makes them shorter and nicer.
fields.summary: Generating proper URLs even when you have &, " ", etc, as part of the title

fields.description:
When moving a page to another space, if a noformat or code macro contains a link to a real other page inside the original space, eg [Some Other Actual Page] where that page title does exist, then the move operation incorrectly adds the space key to [Some Other Actual Page]. It should completely ignore all text inside noformat or code blocks as it is never rendered into a link.

To replicate:
1) Create a new page with the title Toggle-Cloak
2) Create another new page and paste the pre-move markup below into it
3) Move the second page to another space

The noformat and code content will have been modified.

--- BEGIN PRE-MOVE MARKUP ---
h3. Real link
[Toggle-Cloak]

h3. Noformat Text Link

{noformat}
[Toggle-Cloak]
{noformat}

h3. Code Panel

{code}
[Toggle-Cloak]
{code}
--- END PRE-MOVE MARKUP ---

--- BEGIN POST-MOVE MARKUP ---
h3. Real link

[test:Toggle-Cloak]

h3. Noformat Text Link

{noformat}
[test:Toggle-Cloak]
{noformat}

h3. Code Panel

{code}
[test:Toggle-Cloak]
{code}
--- END POST-MOVE MARKUP ---
fields.summary: Move page operation should not add space keys to links inside noformat or code blocks

fields.description:
Rewrite the system error page to request that users contact their Confluence administrator rather than lodging the support ticket themselves.

-- Begin New Error Message ---
Confluence System Error!

Please report this problem to your Confluence administrator and include the following information:

  1. A copy of all text on this page
  2. A description of what you were doing at the time the problem occured

If you are the Confluence administrator, you can create a support ticket at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:

   1. A description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
   2. A copy of all text on this page
   3. Attach a zip of your Confluence logs directory and any other application server logs

Apologies for the inconvenience.
fields.summary: Error page should ask users to contact Confluence administrator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7526].
  {panel}

When editing a page, if a user accidentally clicks cancel, the draft is immediately discarded without method of recovery. Since cancelling destroys data permanently, a confirmation dialogue box should pop-up to provide users with an opportunity to avoid losing their change.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 10 December 2014 |borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
UPDATE 12 Jan 2015: We have resolved this issue, though using a slightly different approach: 
In Edit Mode: "Cancel" has been renamed to "Close" and will NOT discard your work. Drafts are auto-saved and recoverable. 
In Preview Mode: "Cancel"/"Close" has been disabled! Click "Edit" to go back to the editor. 
In Comment Editor: "Cancel" will show a confirmation dialog to warn that comments will be lost. 

This will be available in the upcoming Confluence release (5.7) - within a couple of months and will also be available to Cloud (previously OnDemand) customers within a few weeks. Stay tuned. 
----

Thank you for your suggestions and feedback on this issue. We acknowledge this issue is causing pain & inconvenience. We are currently looking into this and will update this issue when we've make progress on it.

Henk Kleynhans
Senior Product Manager - Confluence
{panel}
fields.summary: Add cancel confirmation dialog to edit page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7524].
  {panel}

The contentbylabel macro is designed to print a small number of label results with lots of detail, but is unsuited to listing a large number of page titles. 

The contentbylabel macro can list pages in this configuration {contentbylabel:confluence|maxResults=99|showLabels=false|showSpace=false|type=page} but is cluttered.

I suggest adding 2 minor parameters to the contentbylabel macro, and creating a new titlebylabel macro which is the contentbylabel macro with different defaults.

1) Add a optional boolean parameter 'lines'. At present, the macro prints thin horizontal lines between each page containing a target label on the results list. When using the macro only to display page titles, this reduces readability on long lists.  Because the visual style does not match the style link lists created manually or using the children macro, it also looks bad when used in the same page as with other link title lists. If a user specifies lines=false, no lines are printed.

2) Enable maxResults=-1 to disable a limit on the number of results

3) Add a new titlebylabel macro which is the contentbylabel macro with the following defaults:

maxResults=-1
showLabels=false
showSpace=false
type=page
lines=false
fields.summary: Create Title By Label macro for page listings

fields.description: Because the activity plugin stores its data in lucene, each node has its own activity logs. Passing all the activity events between nodes would cause a lot of unnecessary load. We need some way to efficiently aggregate tracking information between the different nodes (that would survive even if one node, and all its tracking data, went away)
fields.summary: Activity plugin does not work in a cluster

fields.description: Is it possible to modify the Confluence search to search data stored in calendars added via the calendar plugin?
fields.summary: Add ability for Confluence search to search data added to calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7518].
  {panel}

We currently have our Confluence (and Jira) servers behind an in-house SSO solution (we have done the integration ourselves using a filter).

This is great for browser access - but poses a number of problems for remote-api/trackback/rss access because they dont know how to negotiate the SSO.

What we would like to do is bypass SSO for all non-browser access. Problem is that things like trackbacks & SOAP api all use the global Server URL configuration.

Is there any chance we can specify 2 server URL's? One to be used in email (I think that is the only browser related one?) and one to be used for SOAP API, trackbacks, etc.

Prime importance at the moment is the SOAP api. The WSDL endpoint currently specifies the SSO-protected URL - so SOAP api is unusable for us.
Is there a quick workaround for the WSDL endpiont URL problem?
fields.summary: Need to be able to specify more than 1 Server URL (ie different URL's remote API's & email integration)

fields.description:
We used to require all users to update their profile page with email address, phone number, Instant messenger Ids, etc...
Now that we have created personal spaces, the public profile is no longer accessible.
Many of our users have created a personal space and clicking their name now gives a unfriendly "Not Permitted "

These two concepts should be seperated. Public profile, personal space.
fields.summary: Creating personal space does not copy existing profile content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7505].
  {panel}

New Page: Confluence Permissions Guide
Description: Simple list of possibly security configurations
Add to: [DOC:Security Overview]
Rough Content:
* Users who are not logged in are anonymous users and are not a member of any groups. If Anonymous access is enabled, they will be able to access spaces and pages where Anonymous users have view access.
* Once logged in, a user is a member of {{confluence-users}}
* In the example below has a group {{employees}}. A portion of the users in {{employees}} are in the {{managers}} group as well. 

Image showing Managers are a subset of Employees

These groups can be arranged to provide the following permissions:

|| Knows Page Title || Readable By || Anonymous Access || Has View Space || Has View Page To ||
| Anyone | Anyone | Enabled | None | None |
| Anyone | Logged-In Users | Enabled | Anonymous | confluence-users | 
| Logged-In Users | Logged-In Users | Enabled | confluence-users | confluence-users | 
| Logged-In Users | Employees  | N/A | confluence-users | employees | 
| Employees | Employees | N/A | employees | No restriction |
| Employees | Managers | N/A | employees | managers |
| Managers | Managers | N/A | managers | No restriction |

Explanation of Knows Page Title, Readable By...

Page Titles are visible to any user that can view the space, so secret pages must be in a restricted space
fields.summary: Create Content Permissions Guide

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7504].
  {panel}

confluence doesn't support the creation of alpha lists.  likewise, it doesn't support alpha-numeric lists.  You should be able to create alpha lists as well as numeric and bulleted lists.   this makes numeric lists with subpoints apear cleaner, especially if there are a lot of sequential subpoints (bullets run together and are not easily referenced and multiple numbered lists nested in a numbered list are confusing)

This is essentially what i want to create
1. information
2. more information
    a. subpoint
    b. another subpoint
3. more information

and its reverse:
A. information
B. more information
     1. subpoint
     2. another subpoint
C. more information
fields.summary: Should be able to create alpha lists and alpha numeric lists (alphabetic list items)

fields.description:
If you type in a livesearch box, say looking for the word "source" as you complete the word the potential hit list goes to zero.

For an example see a test page I've set up 

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/LiveSearch+test

with the simple macro {livesearch:spaceKey=ds} ( Note the space has to be ds not TEST as another bug stops non-lower case spaces working ).

Just type 'source' in the box and watch what happens to the hit list.

This is not what the user will expect and seriously undermines the usefulness of this feature - the expected behaviour is to see all the pages with the word source in them!

fields.description:
To reproduce this bug:

1. Create a new page and open for edit in the Rich text editor.
2. Enter in text box:  (+)
3. Save page.  Content will be renedered in View as a plus emoticon.
4. Open for Edit again in Wiki Markup editor.
5. Use the escape character to force the string to appear as text by changing  the content to \(\+\)
6. Save page. Content will be rendered as the normal text: (+)
7. Open for Edit then save without making any changes.
8. Content will be rendered in View as a plus emoticon again.

Somewhere, the escape characters are being removed.
fields.summary: Escaped (+) and (-) in content revert to emoticons when opening for Edit

fields.description:
If an indexed attachment is very large, then rendering the results page is quite slow.  In this instance, the attachments were a pair of Excel documents that were each larger than 5 megs.  These documents did not need to be indexed, so I replaced the user's attachments with zipped versions of the documents.

It would be nice if there was a test and whatever process is actually taking so long was skipped for these large documents, so that server time is not wasted when searching for any word that appears in this large document.  My guess is that the time is spent rendering the context lines, but the profiling output isn't that detailed.
fields.summary: Rendering search results very slow if source document is large

fields.description:
Using a tag like
{blog-posts:labels=abc}
in a page displays all news with label "abc" - fine so far.

Now, take one of the news displayed and remove the label "abc" from it  -> the news is still displayed but it shouldn't
Take an existing news and give it a tag "abc"  -> it is not displayed in the blog-posts list, but it should

Here only flushing the cache leads to a correct displaying of the blog-posts tag.
I found this behaviour also reported on http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=96&threadID=12379 

Are there any workarounds until this is fixed?
fields.summary: update blog-posts if label changes fails

fields.description:
Javadoc 5.0 allows the JavaDoc of particular class to be displayed directly using the URLs. For example:

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/index.html?java/lang/String.html

All the links within the page will be broken if the URL above is generated from a shortcut link. Using the URL above as an example, the URL generated will look like:

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/index.html?java%2Flang%2FString.html

Please follow these steps to reproduce the bug:
1) Create a shortcut link with the expanded value of "http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/index.html?"
2) Create a page that uses the shortcut link. For example, "[java/lang/String@shortcutlink]"
3) Click on the rendered link
4) After the page is loaded, click on any of the links within it.
fields.summary: Shortcut links URL encoding breaks javadoc link generation

fields.description:
Confluence takes several minutes to render pages when an LDAP connection is set as the primary user repository but the LDAP connection is timing out.

Repository lookups that are expected to take a short time, such as group permission checks, should have a shorter timeout such as 5 seconds. Only when searching for users or groups should a long timeout be used.

If the timeout is reached when attempting to login, the user should be informed that they should contact their administrator along with some technical information on the repository that timed out.

To duplicate, Configure an LDAP server as per http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/sZAC Once the LDAP is fully configured, login as a local user, and force connection attempts to time out by choosing another IP, turning off the LDAP server, etc for the LDAP server

1 - When a lookup to a repository is performed and times out, an error should be displayed in the browser. 

Report to to user on login page when a repository times out 

"An error occured - please contact your system administrator and inform them that "A user repository has failed due to timeout"
fields.summary: Confluence responds extremely slowly if LDAP connection times out

fields.description:
Entering text like this issue where lines are created by merely entering a new-line character - like so -
causes the rendered text to display a line-break.

This problem also affects JIRA 3.7 (and earlier?).

This violates standard wiki markup behaviour as known in all major wikis I know of (wikipedia, c2, ...).
Wiki markups and others like HTML, Tex/LaTex, etc. follow the principle of _What you get is what you mean_ 
(WYGIWYM), not WYSIWYG. This usually means:
* Empty line creates new paragraph
* Line-break is explicit
* New line does *not* create a line-break, 

In addition, Confluence and JIRA have line-break markup, vis. {noformat}\\{noformat}. This markup
is either superfluous (as the current rendering shows) or its intention has been corrupted as described
in this bug.
 
I dislike the fact that I am forced to write sentences spreading for ever across the screen in order to avoid funny formatting of my text (as I am doing right now). This also violates the long accepted advice to reduce the width of printed text. However, reducing the browser to a width that is acceptable for editing is most often not acceptable when viewing JIRA issues in tabular form. Switching widths depending on context is _not_ an acceptable workaround.

*Summary:* Change rendering behaviour to fall in line with other wiki editors.
fields.summary: Newline character creates linebreak

fields.description:
The default Wiki pages include in their header:

<META HTTP-EQUIV="Pragma" CONTENT="no-cache">
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Expires" CONTENT="-1">

But Pragma: no-cache and Expires=-1 are HTTP headers defined in HTTP/1.0, not HTTP/1.1. It's not really appropriate for most enterprise deployments, where everyone is running a browser newer than IE 5. 

There is no reason to 'not cache'. You just want to validate the cache. With Pragma: no-cache, some browsers will not let you use the page you already loaded when you hit the 'back' button, and thus reload the page, scroll to the top, throw away any form data that might already be partially filled in.

It would be better to use HTTP/1.1 constructs; perhaps 

cache-control: max-age=0

and even better to put that in the HTTP server, rather than sticking it into every HTML page sent over the net.
fields.summary: Remove meta cache control elements from Confluence HTML

fields.description:
On some extranet pages (every couple of times), I get a page load without javascript or css.

For example, the link to the CSS on this page:

  http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/%7Edaniel.hurst@atlassian.com/Specifications?focusedCommentId=500334761#comment-500334761

Is this:
  http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/%7Edaniel.hurst@atlassian.com/null/s/638/1/1/_/styles/main-action.css?spaceKey=~daniel.hurst@atlassian.com

A refresh seems to fix it about 50% of the time.

It seems to be that instead of 'request.getContextPath()', we are getting '/display/%7Edaniel.hurst@atlassian.com/null/' instead.  Looks like some race condition?
fields.summary: Intermittent problem loading stylesheets and javascript on extranet

fields.description:
From CSP-6166: "After noticing slow performance during first login we did some tracing and found that the application is doing numerous different searches when the user first logs in and accesses the dashboard. The first LDAP search returns all the groups the user belongs to and the subsequent LDAP searches return every user in every single one of the groups from the first search. The impact this has is very large when somebody who belongs to many groups with many users logs in to Confluence. We have extended the period of time that the LDAP data is cached, but this still does not resolve the issue when the users data has not yet be cached. We would like to know what the purpose of the subsequent searches is for and if this can be minimized by changing a property file or making some other modification since the impact on our LDAP server is so big."

I believe that this is afother users as well.
fields.summary: LDAP does a search that returns every user for every group that the logged in user belongs to.

fields.description: Currently you can't have a page be viewable if the parent is restricted. This is a problem if one embedded page needs to be seen, but the rest are to remain restricted. It would be nice if in addition to disallow permissions, to have allow permissions.
fields.summary: Allow single page in space to be viewed, even if parents are restricted

fields.description:
Bug in menu creating JavaScript in Theme Builder 2.0
 
If a menu includes a link to a page (via {children} macro for example) that has view-restrictions, it will cause the menu building process to fail and the menu is not shown (script error in IE7/Firefox). For example, a page with Restrict View to "Me" causes the menu to fail on all other users except the one who set the restriction.
fields.summary: Bug in menu creating JavaScript in Theme Builder 2.0

fields.description:
In "Admin - User Manager" there is the possibility to search for users to edit them. Unfortunately this is missing at "Admin - Group Manager". When you have a lot of groups, killing one group would be cruel.

So why not make it possible to search for groups, like it is resolved with the users.
fields.summary: Search for groups in "Admin - GroupManager"
